instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy

Dead machine, replaces ISL, <CHIP>U6901</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>, but no result. 
I understand little about this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
I don't know what translation software use, but is very poor.

Post <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> level and check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to central pin of Magsafe connector.
Did you try other DCIN board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> 1.15V. I have continuity from the component to the connector.

"Did you try other DCIN board?" I tested one that I am sure works.


[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.deepl.com/translator[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> 1.15V"
Bad value.

Post diode mode to ground.
Check <RESISTOR>R5075</RESISTOR>; if good, reball SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message: I performed the SMC reball.  tested in <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> 0.625V diode mode.  There is no <RESISTOR>R5075</RESISTOR>.  no results.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
"There is no <RESISTOR>R5075</RESISTOR>"
Yeah, that is true; check <RESISTOR>R6929</RESISTOR> instead.

Post <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/1 voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light at magSafe, does not alloy
threads.message:
Wait, no <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>???
Do you mean the board does not even turn on?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> present?

Please, learn a bit of english and post SUFFICIENT information, so we can help you.
